column1: Dharmabad is a town and a municipal council in Nanded district in the state of Maharashtra
column2: India. It is located near the state border with Telangana. Dharmabad has an average elevation of 359 metres (1
column3: 178 ft). It is connected by railway. An industrial training institute was established in the town in 1977.
936. Males constitute 51% of the population and females 49%. Dharmabad has an average literacy rate of 58%
column4: lower than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 69% and
column6: 14% of the population is under 6 years of age.

column1: Dharmabad is connected with the state capital
column2: Mumbai and the capital of neighboring state Telangana
column3: Hyderabad and other major cities like Nizamabad
column4: Nanded and Secunderabad by train. Dharmabad is one of the biggest revenue generating station for South Central Railway. The important trains running from are the Devgiri Express
column6: and the Marathwada Express. The Marathwada Express starts from Dharmabad and is also known as the High Court Express because it connects the Nanded District with Aurangabad High Court.

column1: Dharmabad is also connected with other cities by MSRTC Bus Service. For Lord Vitthal-Rakhumai devotees a bus runs from Dharmabad to Pandharpur. As Dharmabad is located on the Maharashtraâ€“Telangana Border
column2: TSRTC buses also visit the town.
